full_text: Screened by NARA, 8/11/2023 Inpatient Services in a Cooperating 80% of a usual and customary charge See page 8. Specialty Hospital. Participating for up to 120 days in each benefit Skilled Nursing Facility or Cooperating period. Skilled Nursing Facility by a Physician. Outpatient Medical Services. 80% of the routine charge. See page 9. OTHER HEALTH SERVICES 809; of the reasonable charge. See page 9. Prescription Drugs Physical Therapy Medical Appliances Visiting Nurse Association Services for Nursing and Physical Therapy Coordinated Home Health Agency Care Diagnostic Lab Services Ambulance Services Oxygen and Equipment Part 1 BENEFIT PERIOD means: the period of time which starts on the first day (which is NOT part of a prior benefit period) on which you get covered inpatient care. It ends when you have gone 90 days in a row without being an inpatient. Any admission for major surgery or accident treatment will not be considered part of a prior benefit period. Definitions BLUE CROSS means: Blue Cross of Massachusetts, Inc. BLUE SHIELD means: Blue Shield of Massachusetts, Inc. CONTRACT means: this certificate, any amendments to this certificate, any supplemental agreements and your application. COOPERATING SKILLED NURSING FACILITY means: a facility which qualifies as a skilled nursing facility under Social Security regulations and has an agreement with Blue Cross, other than as a participating skilled nursing facility, to provide the services described in your contract. COOPERATING SPECIALTY HOSPITAL means: a specialty hospital. other than a mental hospital or hospital for the treatment of drug addiction or chronic alcoholism. which has an agreement with Blue Cross to provide the services described in your contract. COVERED INPATIENT CARE means: medically necessary services provided to a patient whose condition requires that level of care appropriate to a bed patient. Page 4
